page.title: 03OPINIONS ON COUNTRY MATTERS
page.content: Excessive numbers of stock are allowed to graze on the moor,consequently too many animals are in poor condition or actually starving. Foxes,moles and rabbits are considered a nuisance and there are too many magpies.On the whole there is tolerence of all wildlife.There is hostility to Government policy of gassing badgers;only a few people think they should be destroyed. Holiday cottages are generally not liked, though tolerated if they are well used. They are considered to force prices up artificially making it difficult for young people to afford a house or find anywhere to live, and difficult for farmers to house agricultural workers.
